Leaves: Flattened or rolled blades up to 30 cm long. Slightly to strongly ribbed, densely hairy. Rough texture.
Flowers: Narrow flowerhead with brown or purplish spikelets which are up to 1.5 cm long.
Habitat: Native grass which is widespread throughout Australia, particularly the southern half. Found in dry woodlands, grasslands, shrublands, open forests, coastlines.
DistinguishingFeatures: Many variable subspecies and hard to distinguish from other native speargrasses and introduced tussockgrasses. Best to get expert advice.
Impacts: Note - this is a native grass.

Photos.Caption: Silky flowers held high above leaves
